intro: Alternanthera moquinii, commonly known as the red-stemmed alternanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red or purple stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with green and white. This species belongs to the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many ornamental and edible plants. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant is popular in aquatic gardens and as a decorative foliage plant in both indoor and outdoor settings.
